physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. Only his head and upper torso are captured in the photograph. He has very short hair and he is wearing a collared outfit.
sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows a portrait of Gho Boen Keil. The studio mark of J. B. Jasper is stamped on the back of the carte. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
subject_terms_1: black-and-white photographs studio portraits men (male humans)
